messages.message: @will @Ashish I'm trying to build Docker.standalone for jupyter notebook to test the python version bump to 3.7, but I get an error `E: Unable to locate package python-pip` on step 6 `Step 6/54 : RUN apt-get update -qq && apt-get install -yq --no-install-recommends 	  python   python3 	  python3-pip 	  python-pip &&   apt-get clean &&   rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*`. This is on my local computer. Have you run into this issue before?
Python2 isn't a base package on 20.04
You can remove it, use a ppa that provides it, or switch to pyenv or something similar
I'm not very familiar with the notebook docker - should we just remove py2 from it?
maybe this is a question for @Ashish and @Mohit? Sounds like they own it now? Also, does this mean we haven't rebuilt the standalone Docker image in awhile? (if it doesn't build anymore)
Yeah, the notebooks historically have not been built or updated regularly
I am not sure about removing it, @Ashish should have the context for this.

@lydia if it allows you to move faster, please feel free to remove py2. Once your testing is working end-to-end with blueprint + notebook, Mohit and I can take care of rebuilding the notebook with py3 and py2.
